title: Opt out of lobby.
body:
We all know these games where someone troll picks Soraka top because someone banned his precious Yasuo or when someone picks Janna jungle because stealing drakes with twisters is so OP. 

When you are in your promo's it is especially annoying when you are unable to dodge and left to play with what you get and I think it's not fair to lose a promos game for dodging when your team is clearly troll picking or whatever.

So my suggestion is an opt-out system, where at least 4 players chose to opt out of a game and the game making is canceled without being penalized with a 3 lp or promos loss. 

Now I hear you say, yeah but then if you don't like the enemy team you will just opt out and find another game. 
I say limit your opt-outs like aram rerolls are limited. Why is it so bad for people to be able to get out of a bad game every once in a while? Why be forced to play troll games? 
Okay maybe this idea isn't polished off yet, but with some input from the community there might be something to think of.

At least let people dodge 1 promo game without penalty.

I play jhin jungle kinda often and its good. That guy was just bad.

This is such a good idea, even if it was a limited number of opt-outs per day per person.

Riot wants everyone to believe there are no trolls and no midlane eve+teemo duos, sadly. The "only 5% of players ever receive punishment" statistic must also include inactive accounts.
Only if it then treats the people who opted out as joining a brand new queue so they have to wait from the beginning, otherwise it will just be abused to dodge off meta picks for free.
